section.name: Configuration
section.p: Configuring Tweial is not that difficult. This page documents everything you need to do.

section.name: JRE
section.p: Tweial requires Java 8+. The Windows and Linux downloads come embedded with a Java 8 JRE, so Tweial does not depend on the system-level JRE to run.
However, if you want to override the JRE which comes embedded with Tweial, you can do so by editing, in the [TWEIAL_HOME]/bin/ directory, the start-tweial.sh, start-tweial.bat files.

section.name: Logging
section.p: See the Logging page for more information about configuring logging.

section.name: SMTP Account
section.p: Tweial needs the SMTP information for your email provider. Each email provider is different so how you get this information is up to you.
In the [TWEIAL_HOME]/conf/ directory, make a copy of email(example).properties as email.properties. Edit email.properties, adding your SMTP account details.
section.source: host=smtp.somewhere.org // Hostname of the SMTP server port=44 // Port of the SMTP server sslEnabled=true || false // Is SSL required, "true" or "false" username=acccount // Your email account username password=password // Your email account clear-text password emailAddress=account@somewhere.org // Your email account address sendToAddress=someone@somewhere.org // The email address to send the email to. Defaults // to the 'emailAddress' property if this property is missing

section.name: Twitter Account
section.p: Tweial uses the Twitter4J libraries to communicate with Twitter. In order for this communication to be successful, you need to add Tweial as an authorized application on your account.

p.blockquote:
NOTE:
Refer to my blogger article on how to authorize Tweial with your Twitter account.

section.p: After you have added Tweial as an authorized applicaiton on your Twitter account, in the [TWEIAL_HOME]/conf/ directory, make a copy of twitter(example).properties as twitter.properties. Edit twitter.properties, adding the OAUTH details.
